title: Cedric Richmond
added: Richmond was re-elected with 63.6% of the vote.

title: Cedric Richmond
added: On November 17, 2020, Richmond announced that he will join the [[Biden administration]] as [[Senior Advisor to the President of the United States|Senior Advisor to the President]] and director of the White House [[Office of Public Liaison]].<ref name="Jansen" />

title: Cedric Richmond
added: On November 17, 2020, Richmond announced that he will join the [[Biden administration]] as [[Senior Advisor to the President of the United States|Senior Advisor to the President]] and director of the White House [[Office of Public Liaison]].<ref name="Mackel" /><ref name="Jansen" />Richmond will resign from his congressional seat in January 2021.<ref name="Jansen" />

title: Cedric Richmond
added: Richmond was one of a few Democrats who voted to authorize the [[Keystone Pipeline|Keystone XL pipeline]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Progressive group slams Biden White House pick over tie to fossil fuel industry |url=https://thehill.com/policy/energy-environment/526405-progressive-group-slams-biden-white-house-pick-over-fossil-fuels |accessdate=November 17, 2020 |work=The Hill |date=November 17, 2020}}</ref>

title: Cedric Richmond
added: The progressive groups [[Justice Democrats]] and the [[Sunrise Movement]] issued statements saying that Biden's selection of Richmond was a mistake, citing donations he received from the fossil fuel industry.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Wise |first1=Alana |last2=Khalid |first2=Asma |title=Biden Taps Several Senior Campaign Aides For Key White House Positions |url=https://www.npr.org/sections/biden-transition-updates/2020/11/17/935532199/biden-taps-several-senior-campaign-aides-for-key-white-house-positions |accessdate=November 17, 2020 |work=NPR |date=November 17, 2020}}</ref>

title: Cedric Richmond
added: The progressive groups [[Justice Democrats]] and the [[Sunrise Movement]] issued statements saying that Biden's selection of Richmond was a mistake, citing donations he received from the fossil fuel industry.<ref name="Biden Taps Several Senior Campaign Aides">{{cite news |last1=Wise |first1=Alana |last2=Khalid |first2=Asma |title=Biden Taps Several Senior Campaign Aides For Key White House Positions |url=https://www.npr.org/sections/biden-transition-updates/2020/11/17/935532199/biden-taps-several-senior-campaign-aides-for-key-white-house-positions |accessdate=November 17, 2020 |work=NPR |date=November 17, 2020}}</ref>
